messages.subject: Joylyns weekend
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/3/03 10:32:04 AM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/3/03 10:32:04 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
I should say, Ren, that your sigline quote is very musical in my head. >>

You know, I had meant to change it a while back, but it just wouldn't let me!
It's musical in a rhythmic way in my head and it just seems to be everything
I could ever want in a sig line.
Plus, I love The Secret Garden, which it is from.
It chose me....so it's staying for now.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Joylyns weekend
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/2/03 3:10:42 PM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/2/03 3:10:42 PM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< like watching a
very
slow-motion flower-cart wreck in the set for the marketplace of the recent
Disney version of Roger's and Hammerstein Cinderella >>

I should say, Ren, that your sigline quote is very musical in my head. I
glance at it and first my head starts playing
"The sun is shining and the grass is green,
Under the three feet of show I mean..."

and then (every time) I glance on down and the song changes to Whitney
Houston as the fairy godmother singing

"...there is music in you!"

["The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers
are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."]

My bread machine plays 'Scotland the Brave.' Only the rhythm, but it's
sufficient for my head to supply the rest.

Sandra

messages.subject: Joylyns weekend
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/2/03 12:38:40 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/2/03 12:38:40 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< So for a change I observed in silent amusement. It was like watching a
very
slow-motion flower-cart wreck in the set for the marketplace of the recent
Disney version of Roger's and Hammerstein Cinderella. All cartoon-colorful
and fantasy-worldly, with no soundtrack. Flowers fly up and the picture
freezes without it even mattering where they fall or what happens next. >>

Oh, that is a GREAT visual.
I was laughing out loud just picturing the conservative folks reaction!!
Thanks Sandra.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
